New Records: The Padres hit their first trio of back-to-back-to-back homers in 27 years.
Key Match Events: Dylan Cease took a perfect game into the sixth
Framber Valdez virtually kept pace amid a pitching duel
Manny Machado broke a scoreless tie in the sixth with his second home run in two days
The Padres hit San Diego's first trio of back-to-back-to-back homers in 27 years in the bottom of the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres are already experiencing October baseball and are in a position to clinch a postseason berth as soon as Saturday
Post-Match Reflections: Manny Machado said the team has been playing postseason baseball for the last month and every game counts
Manager Mike Shildt said the whole group's been tremendous and the Padres' once-iffy rotation has pitched to a 2.44 ERA since Sept. 1
Manny Machado has hit.323 since July 27 and his 16 home runs in that span are tied for the second-most in the majors
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres are 3 1/2 games behind the first-place Los Angeles Dodgers, with a three-game visit to Dodger Stadium scheduled next week
San Diego has a 2 1/2-game lead over Arizona in the race for the National League's top wild-card spot
